They're available 7 days per week, 24 hours.
You can visit their website on https://www.113.nl/

values.text: Hmm, let me think of some advice to make you feel better...
For example, you can try a hobby or do some exercise. This can also be mindful activities or yoga.  Bake some cookies. Draw something silly.
Watch your favourite show with the comfort of a warm blanket and a nice cup of tea. Call a friend. Listen or sing to your favourite music.

Spend some quality time with your pet, if you have any. Write down what bothers you and then think about what advice you would give to a friend that struggles with the same issue. Read a book and just forget about the world for a while.

I'm made with Watson Assistant Lite, which is a product of IBM. I'm stored on the IBM Cloud in London.
IBM uses log data, for continuous learning from and improving their Watson Assistant product. This data is kept for 7 days and is not shared or made public.
In addition, all messages are encrypted. This means the order of the letters is scrambled, such that the content becomes unreadable. A key is needed to make the messages readable again.
If you want more information about IBM's views on the GDPR, you can visit this website: https://www.ibm.com/data-responsibility/gdpr/

values.text: The ARQ IVP hotline provides psychological help for a traumatic event.
You can contact them on 088-3305500 (usual call charges).
They're available 7 days per week, from 8:30 until 21:30.
You can visit their website on https://www.ivp.nl/ivp-accent/zorgprofessionals
Pfew. I'm glad I only exist in this world of 0's and 1's!
Ahww... I hope the weather will be better tomorrow!
Great to hear! I'm curious, what are you going to try?
Sure! Let me think, ehh... Here are some!
Take a look through your photo albums. Relive those moments again. Play a musical instrument. Feel the sun on your skin. Play a (video)game.
Dance your stress away. Meet up with a friend. Water your plants. Eat a healthy snack. Light up a candle.
Cry as much as you want to feel relieved after it. Don't feel bad or ashamed about it. If it feels good to do, just do it.
Or you can try the 4-7-8 breathing exercise. This means breathe in for 4 seconds through your nose. Then, hold your breath for 7 seconds. Finally, breathe out for 8 seconds through your mouth.

values.text: I'm a chatbot built by Geertje Peters Rit as a part of her Artificial Intelligence bachelor thesis.  I'm built with Watson Assistant Lite, which is a product of IBM.
You can chat with me on this website. Please note that after 5 minutes of inactivity, the chat session ends.

To lighten the mood, I can also make some jokes or talk about the weather. However, please be aware that I can't replace a real human therapist. I'm just simply a tool to make mental health more accessible. Currently, I can only speak English.

If you're interested in mental health chatbots, you could check out Woebot. Woebot is built by Stanford-trained psychologists. With the help of cognitive behavioural therapy, Woebot has some useful skills to provide support. You can visitethe website here: https://woebothealth.com/
